page.title: 16TOURISM
page.content: The Yorkshire Dales have been popular with tourists for more than a hundred years. Many guide books have been written about the area, though Bellerby is very rarely mentioned. It has very little to attract tourists when compared with the more scenic and historically interesting villages such as Aysgarth, Middleham and Bainbridge. However, in recent years many people have begun to provide bed and breakfast and self-catering accommodation for visitors and so some tourists use Bellerby as a base from which to explore other places. The Dales have become even more popular in recent years, particularly to foreign visitors. This is mainly due to the books by James Herriot about his experiences as a vet in the Dales in the thirties and forties.
